## Setup

Import libraries:




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(unglue)
```
:::




Read text input from file and convert into a vector of positive (R) or negative (L) numbers:




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
input <- read_lines("../input/day01.txt") |> 
  unglue_data("{dir=L|R}{num=\\d+}", convert = TRUE) |> 
  mutate(num = case_match(dir, "R" ~ num, "L" ~ -num)) |> 
  pull(num)
```
:::




## Part 1

Starting from 50, apply all rotations in sequence as **additions modulo 100**, then count the number of zeroes in the resulting sequence:




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
input |> 
  accumulate(.f = \(x, y) (x + y) %% 100, .init = 50) |> 
  keep(\(x) x == 0) |> 
  length()
```
:::
